content.body:
ecmarkup language service update:

I added underline to AOs that might trigger user codes. I need a temperature check, do you think this is good, or visually annoying?
I found usually `? ` and `! ` before the AO call indicates if it triggers user code or not.
content.formatted_body:
ecmarkup language service update:

I added underline to AOs that might trigger user codes. I need a temperature check, do you think this is good, or visually annoying?
I found usually ? and ! before the AO call indicates if it triggers user code or not.

content.body: underline to me suggests "link" rather than something so esoteric (e.g., as applied to `#sec-array.from` in the screenshot). Also, `!` before the call is an indication that it does **not** call user code (because user code can always throw)
content.formatted_body: underline to me suggests "link" rather than something so esoteric (e.g., as applied to #sec-array.from in the screenshot). Also, ! before the call is an indication that it does not call user code (because user code can always throw)
